intro: Octomeria complanata, commonly known as the flatleaf octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded understories of forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
